intro: Argemone pleiacantha subsp. ambigua, commonly known as the Mexican poppy, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers with prominent red or orange markings. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring alternate, lance-shaped leaves with wavy margins. Its capsule-like fruits contain numerous small, oblong seeds that are dispersed by wind. This species is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
